member.name: T:System.Web.Services.Configuration.SoapExtensionTypeElement
member.summary: Represents the SoapExtensionElement in the Web Services configuration file. This element adds a SOAP extension to run with all XML Web services within the scope of the configuration file. The class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Web.Services.Configuration.SoapExtensionTypeElement.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Web.Services.Configuration.SoapExtensionTypeElement.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Web.Services.Configuration.PriorityGroup)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Specifies the SOAP extension class to add.

Indicates the relative order in which a SOAP extension runs when multiple SOAP extensions are specified. Within each group, the priority attribute distinguishes the overall relative priority of the SOAP extension. A lower priority number indicates a higher priority for the SOAP extension. The lowest possible value for the priority attribute is 1.
Along with priority, specifies the relative order in which a SOAP extension runs when multiple SOAP extensions are configured to run.

member.name: M:System.Web.Services.Configuration.SoapExtensionTypeElement.#ctor(System.Type,System.Int32,System.Web.Services.Configuration.PriorityGroup)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Specifies the SOAP extension class to add.
Indicates the relative order in which a SOAP extension runs when multiple SOAP extensions are specified.
Along with priority, specifies the relative order in which a SOAP extension runs when multiple SOAP extensions are configured to run.

member.returns: A object whose value determines relative order in which a SOAP extension runs.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates the relative order in which a SOAP extension runs when multiple SOAP extensions are specified.
